Solution:   Adjust test for allowed white space.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/dfbc5fd879d92c2a79ced1e1d16dc89f4d55772d|patch 8.2.2397: Vim9: "%%" not seen as alternate file name for ":bdel">
patch 8.2.2397: Vim9: "%%" not seen as alternate file name for ":bdel"

Problem:    Vim9: "%%" not seen as alternate file name for commands with a
            buffer name argument.
Solution:   Recognize "%%" like "#". (closes #7732)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2397: Vim9: "%%" not seen as alternate file name for ":bdel" · vim/vim@dfbc5fd
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2397: Vim9: "%%" not seen as alternate file name for ":bdel" · vim/vim@dfbc5fd
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: "%%" not seen as alternate file name for commands with a buffer name argument. Solution: Recognize "%%" like "#". (closes #7732)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/7cebe8ba7dd9a3a955e2da74014f11c42e1c6ac3|patch 8.2.2396: Vim9: no white space allowed before "->">
patch 8.2.2396: Vim9: no white space allowed before "->"

Problem:    Vim9: no white space allowed before "->".
Solution:   Allow for white space. (closes #7725)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2396: Vim9: no white space allowed before "->" · vim/vim@7cebe8b
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2396: Vim9: no white space allowed before "->" · vim/vim@7cebe8b
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: no white space allowed before "->". Solution: Allow for white space. (closes #7725)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/9a562c184d98d82bb7506caf2071cfe15a92fa43|patch 8.2.2395: Vim9: error for wrong type may report wrong line number>
patch 8.2.2395: Vim9: error for wrong type may report wrong line number

Problem:    Vim9: error for wrong type may report wrong line number.
Solution:   Save and restore the line number when evaluating the expression.
            (closes #7727)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2395: Vim9: error for wrong type may report wrong line number · vim/vim@9a562c1
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2395: Vim9: error for wrong type may report wrong line number · vim/vim@9a562c1
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: error for wrong type may report wrong line number. Solution: Save and restore the line number when evaluating the expression. (closes #7727)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/9ae3705b6ebd45086ca13c0f93a93f943559bd15|patch 8.2.2394: Vim9: min() and max() return type is "any">
patch 8.2.2394: Vim9: min() and max() return type is "any"

Problem:    Vim9: min() and max() return type is "any".
Solution:   Use return type "number". (closes #7728)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2394: Vim9: min() and max() return type is "any" · vim/vim@9ae3705
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2394: Vim9: min() and max() return type is "any" · vim/vim@9ae3705
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: min() and max() return type is "any". Solution: Use return type "number". (closes #7728)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/4bce26bb70144633713e7e8f149ba99cac511336|patch 8.2.2393: Vim9: error message when script line starts with "[{">
patch 8.2.2393: Vim9: error message when script line starts with "[{"

Problem:    Vim9: error message when script line starts with "[{".
Solution:   Do not give an error for checking for end of list.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2393: Vim9: error message when script line starts with "[{" · vim/vim@4bce26b
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2393: Vim9: error message when script line starts with "[{" · vim/vim@4bce26b
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: error message when script line starts with "[{". Solution: Do not give an error for checking for end of list.

patch 8.2.2392: fennel filetype not recognized

Problem:    Fennel filetype not recognized.
Solution:   Detect with pattern and hashbang. (Chinmay Dalal, closes #7729)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/0d3de8cb590aed90be71d96eb3dbc6addf80bb11|patch 8.2.2391: memory leak when creating a global function with closure>
patch 8.2.2391: memory leak when creating a global function with closure

Problem:    Memory leak when creating a global function with closure.
Solution:   Create a separate partial for every instantiated function.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2391: memory leak when creating a global function with closure · vim/vim@0d3de8c
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2391: memory leak when creating a global function with closure · vim/vim@0d3de8c
attachments.text: Problem: Memory leak when creating a global function with closure. Solution: Create a separate partial for every instantiated function.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/b3005ce191d27fd2f234df4969d5b58fda9c1940|patch 8.2.2390: Vim9: using positive offset is unexpected>
patch 8.2.2390: Vim9: using positive offset is unexpected

Problem:    Vim9: using positive offset is unexpected.
Solution:   Use int8_T instead of char. (James McCoy)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2390: Vim9: using positive offset is unexpected · vim/vim@b3005ce
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2390: Vim9: using positive offset is unexpected · vim/vim@b3005ce
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: using positive offset is unexpected. Solution: Use int8_T instead of char. (James McCoy)
